ai.summary: Lime Avenue Ponds Walk is a 9.1 km moderate hike in the UK that circles tranquil ponds along a mix of woodland and open paths. Suitable for hikers with moderate fitness, it offers scenic water features and varied terrain with gentle grades.
ai.terrain_summary: The route uses a combination of well-maintained gravel paths, grassy tracks, and occasional boardwalk sections near the ponds. Expect occasional muddy patches after rain and some gentle inclines. Tracks are mostly flat to rolling, with a few short ascents and descents.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and weather-appropriate clothing. The ground can be muddy or slippery near the ponds. Check weather and daylight conditions before setting out. Stay on marked paths, watch for other walkers or cyclists on shared routes, and keep an eye on children and pets. Bring water and a map or a charged phone with offline navigation.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof walking shoes or boots
Map or fully charged phone with offline navigation
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn (March–October) for the best conditions; can be undertaken year-round with proper gear.
